itemDescription: British hairdresser behind blow out styling

wikipedia_page.main: Rose Evansky, née Rose Lerner (30 May 1922 – 21 November 2016) was a British hairdresser notable for introducing the "blow dry" or "blow wave" technique of hairstyling.

response: He was married to Joan Ross in 1946; the couple had two sons and a daughter. The marriage was dissolved, and he later remarried, to Rose Evansky in 1965.Denis Cannan(obituary), The Telegraph, 2 November 2011

After a brief stint working at an auction house in Putney and also as a barrow boy, he used his savings to pay for his hairdressing apprenticeship at Evansky's in Mount Street, London, and trained with the legendary Rose Evansky. Here he met Nigel Davies, a fellow hairdresser. The pair moved to Vidal Sassoon's salon at 171 New Bond Street, London W1.  Davies changed his name to Justin de Villeneuve.
